channel.title: DMT and Salvia
channel.description:
1. How long do you think it will be until Salvia becomes a banned substance? 2. Why is exactly DMT illegal?
That shit is produced in your body and in all living organisms. There have been no reported deaths of DMT. Ever.
The maximal effects of DMT last for about 10 minutes.
I've seen my fair share of anti-drug videos in school. It's usually "if you smoke this, they you could (a) Swallow your tounge or (b) Jump into a lake in die"
Pretty awesome shit: http://youtube.com/watch?v=grcqs9cDuN8&mode=related&search=

ill never do it again.

i doubt it will ever be banned because the government doesn’t want to make it seem like they made a mistake.

item.title: DMT and Salvia
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

PaulT:

We would be so much fucking stronger.

We would also be another species, I don’t think it would be possible for alcohol to replace water, it would burn of a lot of skin and would require evolution to fully be able to do it harmlessly.

[quote=“PaulT, post:13, topic:113647”]1. Never.
2. It’s too much fun.

I just find it strange that alcohol is only legal because the government make a hell of an earning off of taxes from it.

Most people forget that the US had a revolutionary war over alcohol taxes in the late 1700s.[/quote]

I’m not from the US so I wasn’t taught about it at school.

Read full topic

item.title: DMT and Salvia
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

  1. Never.
  2. It’s too much fun.
I just find it strange that alcohol is only legal because the government make a hell of an earning off of taxes from it. :/

Most people forget that the US had a revolutionary war over alcohol taxes in the late 1700s. Alcohol is legal because it’s good for you. Just think how awesome it would be if human beings switched to alcohol from water. We would be so much fucking stronger.

Read full topic

item.title: DMT and Salvia
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

“All living organisms”?

Humans yes, certain plants yes, certain other animals I think, but not everything.

It’s illegal because in today’s society anything that has an effect on your state of mind is considered dangerous. Why is LSD illegal? Salvia will most likely follow soon, although it really shouldn’t. Our governments have no idea how to handle the drug problem, or even what the drug problem really is.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Gravey wrote:

I believe Ron is thinking of LSA?

EDIT: If someone is willing to post an easier (more understandable) way to extract it than
most guides online, I’d be more than delighted to consider reading it.

Read full topic

item.title: DMT and Salvia
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:5, topic:113647”]Well… LSD (I might be thinking of a different illegal substance, but I’m around 90% sure it’s LSD.) is also produced in your body, but it’s an illegal substance to have.

Anything that makes you feel good, the government will try to ban it or create a very very annoying sin tax for it. The sin tax is completely frivolous. It bleeds people who want to have fun or just have a bad habit.[/quote]

Well just to say, LSD definitely isn’t produced by your body. DMT is, and I believe THC or something very chemically similar is also produced by your brain.

Anyways, yeah I would really like to try DMT but I have no access to it and I’m not prepared to mess around with ammonia and other harmful chemicals trying to extract it. Salvia on the other hand, well I love and hate it at the same time but I think it’ll be legal for some time yet. They’ve made a few efforts to ban it here in Canada, but so far have not been able to prove any harmful side effects and I’ve read articles saying that here in Canada it probably wont get banned any time soon.

The whole war on drugs is just a big pile of shit though, it hasn’t done anything for anyone. I really can’t vouch for the United States (since I live in Canada), but I think once my generation becomes older, several substances will be decriminalized. Just lately a lawyer in my town was arrested even after displaying his papers to smoke medical marijuana to treat his multiple sclerosis symptoms and he sued the city for 3 million dollars, and has been writing awesome articles in the news paper about the truth of drugs.

Read full topic

item.title: DMT and Salvia

@Ron wrote:

Well… LSD (I might be thinking of a different illegal substance, but I’m around 90% sure it’s LSD.) is also produced in your body, but it’s an illegal substance to have.

Anything that makes you feel good, the government will try to ban it or create a very very annoying sin tax for it. The sin tax is completely frivolous. It bleeds people who want to have fun or just have a bad habit.
